intro: Cephalophora spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leafed cephalophora, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, umbrella-like inflorescence composed of small white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is often found in forested areas or along stream banks. Its leaves are broad and lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It is valued in horticulture for its attractive foliage and delicate flowers.
